audios.au: The basis function of ECAS is the regulation of a reference level.
A reference level is specified as a predefined distance between the axle and the chassis of the vehicle.
In the case of ECAS reference levels are defined in several ways:
During calibration a driving level is specified as the reference level when the vehicle is in motion.
Using parameterizing, further alternatively selectable driving levels can be specified as reference levels.
And using the remote control unit any desired reference level can be defined and addressed.
